result.execSummary:
The defendant Tara Ann Wipperfurth was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Provide DNA sample.  Undergo any counseling/treatment per agent.  ALL COURT ORDERED OBLIGATIONS TO BE PAID THROUGH CLERK OF COURTS
Upon successful completion of probation and if law abiding & fine paid in full within 18 mos., record may be expunged, 973.015.

If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Tara Ann Wipperfurth in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Defendant Tara Ann Wipperfurth in custody.  Dennis Joseph Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Gumz requests DE's father be allowed to listen in via Atty Gumz'a cell phone.  Court does not object.  Bernice D. reads statement.  Atty Gumz reads statement on behalf of DE's parents.  Atty Gumz requests 1 year jail with huber.  State requests 181 day jail sentence which would allow for a time served sentence.  DE gives statement.  Court orders 240 days in the Sauk County Jail - TIME SERVED.  181 days jail credit.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on October 26, 2017 at 03:00 pm.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on October 13, 2017 at 01:00 pm.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Court finds probable cause, bind over for Br 1.

Defendant Tara Ann Wipperfurth in court with attorney Debra Van Wormer O'Rourke.  Dennis Joseph Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  No Contest Plea entered, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court.  Court finds Defendant guilty.  Court withholds sentence.

Count 1:
18 months Probation
DNA surcharge/sample
Undergo any counseling per agent
AODA & treatment
$518.00 Costs fees (PAID THRU CLERK OF COURTS) 
Upon successful completion of probation and if law abiding & fine paid in full within 18 mos., record may be expunged, 973.015.
Report to probation by 3:30 on 3/16/16
Paperwork handed in court.
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 15, 2016 at 03:45 pm.

Attorney Debra Van Wormer O'Rourke in court.  Dennis Joseph Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney ORourke gives status.  Expected her client today.  Acceptance of the offer.  Defendant may believe matter is still set on for 1 p.m. today.  Request stay of any warrant for another plea/sentencing.  State does not object.  State request warrant, stayed till March 15.  Court so orders.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 15, 2016 at 03:45 pm.

Pre-trial conference at 02-26-2016 11:15 am.
Return date at 03-10-2016 01:00 pm.

Defendant Tara Ann Wipperfurth in court with attorney Debra Van Wormer O'Rourke.  Michael X. Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty O'Rourke states DE will waive time limits at this time.  DE agrees.  Court sets PTC/RD.  Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 26, 2016 at 11:15 am.  Return date scheduled for March 10, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Defendant Tara Ann Wipperfurth appeared by video means from LEC w/atty. Adam Raabe. Prosecuting Atty Sue Mueller appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant recv'd and waives reading of complaint.  Advised rights to an attorney.  State requests $500.00 Cash bond.  Atty. Raabe Requests Preliminary hearing; Time limits NOT waived.  Court sets $500 Cash bond.  Special bond conditions as follows: No poss of controlled substances  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 3, 2016 at 10:30 am.
